pros: Keeps the wave going, thanks to good pull and comfort
Works well on both heads and beards
Durable maple wood brush with 100% boar bristles

cons: Cleaning, washing, and drying the brush is a chore, but needs to be done to make the brush last

customer_reviews.title: Best for short hair, medium length proves to be too thick
customer_reviews.text: Nice build, boars hair feels great against my scalp, especially on the back & sides where my hair is shorter. It doesn't do so well on the top where my hair is longer (medium length - 3 to 4 inches). The bristles struggle to massage/exfoliate my top, which is what I would like. So either I cut my hair, or get another brush with those crappy plastic needles that tear my flesh apart when the rubber tips fall out... and it will happen, it always happens! Guess I'm off to the barber!

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Hold, Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Reviewing a hair brush is a bit more meaningful than reviewing, say, batteries. Because my old brush (a very inexpensive one) was the non-military style (had a handle) and was a challenge to hold at times, the military style version of this brush was very welcome. The bristles appear to be high quality (especially compared to the old brush). Even though the bristles are a little stiffer, I think that will prove beneficial. My only complaint--very minor--is that it came in a flimsy plastic container that opened in the mailing bag. For a brush this nice, at least a regular box container would've been nice.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Bruner

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality brush. I would usually go to Walmart or a local beauty supply store for a brush. Those are just cheap brushes. I finally decided to invest in a brush. After brushing my hair a few times I am wondering to myself why I didn't make this purchase sooner. The brush works wonders for me. The bristles are high quality and don't seem to come out easily. If you care about keeping your hair brushed them this is a good brush worth the investment. This brush also works with beards as well.
customer_reviews.author: Rashad Gattis

customer_reviews.title: Soo wavy
customer_reviews.text: Had the brush a little shy of a week and loving everything about it thus far. What I like about it is that it's small and compact to comfortably fit in the palm of your hand but yet wide enough to cover the curvature around the head when brushing. This is def a MUST HAVE brush for some one with short cuts and waves.
